PREFACE
         This code of the Village of Roanoke, as supplemented, contains
ordinances up to and including ordinance 2024-04, passed June 3, 2024, and
resolution 2025-02, passed March 3, 2025. Ordinances of the Village adopted
after said ordinance supersede the provisions of this code to the extent that
they are in conflict or inconsistent therewith. Consult the Village office in
order to ascertain whether any particular provision of the code has been
amended, superseded or repealed.
                     American Legal Publishing
                     Cincinnati, Ohio

Listed ordinances have been passed, but they are pending review by the
publisher, and they may not amend the code of ordinances. Additionally,
ordinances listed in this section may not show the original ordinances in their
entirety. Please contact the office of the clerk if there are any questions
concerning any listed ordinances.
 
ADOPTING ORDINANCE
ORDINANCE NO. 74-9
AN ORDINANCE PROVIDING FOR THE ADOPTION OF THE OFFICIAL CODE OF THE VILLAGE OF
ROANOKE; PROVIDING FOR THE CONTINUANCE IN EFFECT OF ALL GENERAL LAWS IN EFFECT
ON THE DATE OF SUCH ADOPTION; PROVIDING FOR THE CONTINUATION OF ALL SPECIAL
ORDINANCES NOT INCLUDED IN THE OFFICIAL CODE AND PROVIDING FOR THE REGULAR
SUPPLEMENTATION OF THE OFFICIAL VILLAGE CODE.
BE IT ORDAINED By the President and Board of Trustees of the Village of
Roanoke, Illinois:
   Section 1. Pursuant to the provisions of 65 Illinois Compiled Statutes 5/1-
2-3 of the Illinois Municipal Code and from and after the date of passage of
this ordinance, this Village Code of the Village of Roanoke, Illinois, prepared
by Sterling Codifiers, Inc., under the direction of the governing body of the
Village of Roanoke, is hereby approved and accepted and declared to be the
Official Village Code containing all ordinances of a general nature in effect
at the time of such codification. Said Code shall be accepted in all courts
without question as the Official Code and law of the Village as enacted by the
President and Board of Trustees of the Village of Roanoke.
   Section 2. There is hereby adopted, as a method of perpetual codification,
the loose-leaf type of binding, together with continuous supplement service
provided by Sterling Codifiers, Inc., whereby each newly adopted ordinance of a
general and permanent nature amending, altering, adding to or deleting
provisions of the Official Code is identified by the proper catchline and is
inserted in the proper place in each of the official copies. Each such new
provision shall become effective upon the passage of the ordinance. Insertion
of the proper replacement pages shall be made in the copies of the Code, three
(3) copies of which shall be maintained in the office of the Clerk, certified
as to correctness and available for inspection at any and all times that said
office is regularly open.
   Section 3. All ordinances of a general nature included in this Official
Village Code shall be considered as a continuation of said ordinance provisions
and the fact that some provisions have been deliberately eliminated by the
governing body shall not serve to cause any interruption in the continuous
effectiveness of ordinances included in said Official Village Code. All
ordinances of a special nature, as set forth in the Saving Clause (Title 1,
Chapter 2) of said Code shall continue in full force and effect unless
specifically repealed and amended by provisions of this Village Code. Such
ordinances are not intended to be included in the Official Village Code.
   Section 4. This ordinance shall be in full force and effect immediately upon
its passage, approval and publication in book or pamphlet form as provided by
65 Illinois Compiled Statutes 5/1-2-4 of the Illinois Municipal Code.
PASSED AND APPROVED This  2  day of December, 1974.
   VILLAGE OF ROANOKE
   /S/ Elmer J. Wehrli
   Mayor
ATTEST:
/S/ John G. Paluska
Village Clerk

CHAPTER 1
OFFICIAL VILLAGE CODE
SECTION:
1-1-1: Title
1-1-2: Acceptance
1-1-3: Amendments
1-1-4: Interpretations
1-1-5: Code Alteration
1-1-1: TITLE:
Upon adoption by the Board of Trustees this Village Code is hereby declared to
be and shall hereafter constitute the official Village Code of the Village of
Roanoke. This Village Code of Ordinances shall be known and cited as the
Roanoke Municipal Code, and it is hereby published by authority of the Board of
Trustees and shall be kept up to date as provided in Section
1-1-3 under the direction of the Village Attorney, acting for said Village
Board of Trustees. Any reference to the number of any Section contained herein
shall be understood to refer to the position of the same number, its
appropriate Chapter and Title heading, and to the general penalty clause
relating thereto, as well as to the Section itself, when reference is made to
this Village Code by title in any legal document.
1-1-2: ACCEPTANCE:
This Village Code, as hereby presented in printed form, shall hereafter be
received without further proof in all courts and in all administrative
tribunals of this State as the ordinances of the Village of general and
permanent effect, except the excluded ordinances enumerated in Section
1-2-1 of this Code 1 .
 
Notes
1 1. S.H.A. 65 ILCS 5/1-2-6.
1-1-3: AMENDMENTS:
Any ordinance amending this Village Code shall set forth the Title, Chapter and
Section number of the Section or Sections to be amended, and this shall
constitute a sufficient compliance with any statutory requirement pertaining to
the amendment or revision by ordinance of any part of this Village Code. All
such amendments or revisions by ordinance shall be immediately forwarded to the
codifiers and the said ordinance material shall be prepared for insertion in
its proper place in each copy of this Village Code. Each such replacement page
shall be properly identified and shall be inserted in each individual copy of
the Village Code within thirty (30) days from the date of its final passage.
1-1-4: INTERPRETATIONS:
In the determination of the provisions of each Section of this Code the
following rules shall be observed:
(A) Intent to Defraud: Whenever an intent to defraud is required in order to
constitute an offense, it shall be sufficient if an intent appears to defraud
any person.
(B) Liability of Employers and Agents: When the provisions of any Section of
this Village Code prohibits the commission of an act, not only the person
actually doing the prohibited act or omitting the directed act, but also the
employer and all other persons concerned with or in aiding or abetting the said
person shall be guilty of the offense described and liable to the penalty set
forth.
1-1-5: CODE ALTERATION:
It shall be deemed unlawful for any person to alter, change, replace or deface
in any way any Section or page of this Village Code in such a manner that the
meaning of any phrase or order may be changed or omitted. Replacement pages may
be inserted according to the official instructions when so authorized by the
Village Board. The Clerk shall see that the replacement pages are properly
inserted in the official copies maintained in the office of the Clerk.
Any person having in his custody an official copy of this Village Code shall
make every effort to maintain said Code in an up to date and efficient manner.
He shall see to the immediate insertion of new or replacement pages when such
are delivered to him or made available to him through the office of the Village
Clerk. Said Code Books, while in actual possession of officials and other
interested persons, shall be and remain the property of the Village and shall
be returned to the office of the Clerk when directed so to do by order of the
Village Board. (1974 Code)
CHAPTER 2
SAVINGS CLAUSE
SECTION:
1-2-1: Repeal of General Ordinances
1-2-2: Public Utility Ordinances
1-2-3: Court Proceedings
1-2-1: REPEAL OF GENERAL ORDINANCES:
All general ordinances of the Village passed prior to the adoption of this
Village Code are hereby repealed, except such as are referred to herein as
being still in force or are by necessary implication herein reserved from
repeal (subject to the saving clauses contained in the following Section), from
which are excluded the following ordinances which are not hereby repealed: Tax
levy ordinances; appropriation ordinances; ordinances relating to boundaries
and annexations; franchise ordinances and other ordinances granting special
rights to persons or corporations; contract ordinances and ordinances
authorizing the execution of a contract or the issuance of warrants; salary
ordinances; ordinances establishing, naming or vacating streets, alleys or
other public places; improvement ordinances; bond transfer or acceptance of
real estate by or from the Village; and all special ordinances.
1-2-2: PUBLIC UTILITY ORDINANCES:
No ordinance relating to railroads or railroad crossings with streets and other
public ways, or relating to the conduct, duties, service or rates of public
utilities shall be repealed by virtue of the adoption of this Village Code or
by virtue of the preceding Section, excepting as this Village Code may contain
provisions for such matters, in which case this Village Code shall be
considered as amending such ordinance or ordinances in respect to such
provisions only.
1-2-3: COURT PROCEEDINGS:
No new ordinance shall be construed or held to repeal a former ordinance,
whether such former ordinance is expressly repealed or not, as to any offense
committed against such former ordinance or as to any act done, any penalty,
forfeiture or punishment so incurred, or any right accrued or claim arising
under the former ordinance, or in any way whatever to affect any such offense
or act so committed or so done, or any penalty, forfeiture or punishment so
incurred or any right accrued or claim arising before the new ordinance takes
effect, save only that the proceedings thereafter shall conform to the
ordinance in force at the time of such proceeding, so far as practicable. If
any penalty, forfeiture or punishment be mitigated by any provision of a new
ordinance, such provision may be, by the consent of the party affected, applied
to any judgment announced after the new ordinance takes effect.
This Section shall extend to all repeals, either by express words or
implication, whether the repeal is in the ordinance making any new provisions
upon the same subject or in any other ordinance.
Nothing contained in this Chapter shall be construed as abating any action now
pending under or by virtue of any general ordinance of the Village herein
repealed and the provisions of all general ordinances contained in this Code
shall be deemed to be continuing provisions and not a new enactment of the same
provision; nor shall this Chapter be deemed as discontinuing, abating,
modifying or altering any penalty accrued or to accrue, or any right of the
Village under any ordinance or provision thereof in force at the time of the
adoption of this Village Code. (1974 Code)
CHAPTER 3
DEFINITIONS
SECTION:
1-3-1: Construction of Words
1-3-2: Definitions
1-3-3: Catchlines
1-3-1: CONSTRUCTION OF WORDS:
Whenever any word in any Section of this Village Code importing the plural
number is used in describing or referring to any matters, parties or persons,
any single matter, party or person shall be deemed to be included, although
distributive words may not have been used.
When any subject matter, party or person is referred to in this Village Code by
words importing the singular number only, or the masculine gender, several
matters, parties or persons and females as well as males and bodies corporate
shall be deemed to be included; provided, that these rules of construction
shall not be applied to any Section of this Village Code which contains any
express provision excluding such construction or where the subject matter or
content may be repugnant thereto.
1-3-2: DEFINITIONS:
Whenever the following words or terms are used in this Code they shall have the
meanings herein ascribed to them, unless the context makes such meaning
repugnant thereto:
   AGENT: The word "agent" as used in this Code shall mean a person acting on
behalf of another.
   BOARD: The word "Board", unless otherwise indicated, shall mean the Board of
Trustees of the Village.
   CODE: The word "Code" shall mean the Municipal Code of Roanoke and
amendments thereto.
   COUNTY: The word "County" shall mean County of Woodford.
   EMPLOYEES: Whenever reference is made in this Code to a Village employee by
title only, this shall be construed as though followed by the words "of the
Village of Roanoke".
   FEE: The word "fee" as used in this Code shall mean a sum of money charged
by the Village for the carrying on of a business, profession or occupation.
(1974 Code)
   FISCAL YEAR: The fiscal year of the Village shall begin on the first Monday
of the month of May in each and every year. (R.O. 1908, Ord. 3)
   KNOWINGLY: The word "knowingly" imports only a knowledge that the facts
exist which bring the act or omission within the provisions of this Code. It
does not require any knowledge of the unlawfulness of such act or omission.
   LICENSE: The word "license" as used in this Code shall mean the permission
granted for the carrying on of a business, profession or occupation.
   MISDEMEANOR: The word "misdemeanor" shall mean any offense deemed a
violation of the provisions of this Code which is a lesser offense than a
felony as defined by State law. (1974 Code)
   MUNICIPAL YEAR: The municipal year of the Village shall begin on the first
Monday of the month of May in each and every year. (R.O. 1908, Ord. 3)
   NEGLIGENT: The word "negligent", as well as "neglect", "negligence" and
"negligently" imports a want of such attention to the nature of probable
consequences of the act or omission as a prudent man ordinarily bestows in
acting in his own concern.
   NUISANCE: The word "nuisance" shall mean anything offensive or obnoxious to
the health and welfare of the inhabitants of the Village; or any act or thing
repugnant to, or creating a hazard to, or having a detrimental effect on the
property of another person or to the community.
   OCCUPANT: The word "occupant" applied to a building or land shall include
any person who occupies the whole or any part of such building or land whether
alone or with others.
   OFFENSE: The word "offense" shall mean any act forbidden by any provision of
this Code or the omission of any act required by the provisions of this Code.
   OFFICERS: Whenever reference is made in this Code to a Village officer by
title only, this shall be construed as though followed by the words "of the
Village of Roanoke".
   OPERATOR: The word "operator" as used in this Code shall mean the person who
is in charge of any operation, business or profession.
   OWNER: The word "owner" applied to a building or land shall include any part
owner, joint owner, tenant in common, joint tenant or lessee of the whole or of
a part of such building or land.
   PERSON: The word "person" shall mean any natural individual, firm, trust,
partnership, association or corporation in his or its own capacity or as
administrator, conservator, executor, trustee, receiver or other representative
appointed by the Court. Whenever the word "person" is used in any Section of
this Code prescribing a penalty or fine as applied to partnerships or
associations, the word shall include the partners or members thereof, and such
word as applied to corporations shall include the officers, agents or employees
thereof who are responsible for any violation of said Section.
   PERSONAL PROPERTY: The term "personal property" shall include every
description of money, goods, chattels, effects, evidence of rights in action
and all written instruments by which any pecuniary obligation, right or title
to property is created, acknowledged, transferred, increased, defeated,
discharged or diminished and every right or interest therein.
   RETAILER: The word "retailer" as used in this Code, unless otherwise
specifically defined shall be understood to relate to the sale of goods,
merchandise, articles or things in small quantities direct to the consumer.
   STATE: The word "State", unless otherwise indicated, shall mean the State of
Illinois.
   STREET: The word "street" shall include alleys, lanes, courts, boulevards,
public squares, public places and sidewalks.
   TENANT: The word "tenant" applied to a building or land shall include any
person who occupies the whole or any part of such building or land whether
alone or with others.
   VILLAGE: The word "Village" shall mean the Village of Roanoke, County of
Woodford, State of Illinois.
   WHOLESALER: The words "wholesaler" and "wholesale dealer" as used in this
Code, unless otherwise specifically defined, shall be understood to relate to
the sale of goods, merchandise, articles or things in quantity to persons who
purchase for the purpose of resale.
   WILFULLY: The word "wilfully" when applied to the intent with which an act
is done or omitted, implies simply a purpose or willingness to commit the act
or make the omission referred to. It does not require any intent to violate
law, or to injure another, or to acquire an advantage.
   WRITTEN, IN WRITING: The terms "written" or "in writing" may include
printing and any other mode of representing words and letters, but when the
written signature of any person is required by law to any official or public
writing or bond required by law, it shall be in the proper handwriting of such
person, or in case he is unable to write, by his proper mark.
1-3-3: CATCHLINES:
The catchlines of the several Sections of this Village Code are intended as
mere catchwords to indicate the content of the Section and shall not be deemed
or taken to be titles of such Sections, nor as any part of the Section, nor
unless expressly so provided, shall they be so deemed when any of such
Sections, including the catchlines, are amended or re-enacted. (1974 Code)
CHAPTER 4
GENERAL PENALTY; ENFORCEMENT
SECTION:
1-4-1: Penalty
1-4-2: License
1-4-3: Application
1-4-4: Liability Of Officers
1-4-5: Action Before Proper Officer
1-4-6: Summons; Warrant; Complaint
1-4-7: Contents Of Warrant
1-4-8: Proceed With Trial
1-4-9: Enter Judgment
1-4-10: Arrest Without A Warrant
1-4-11: Execution Of Duty
1-4-12: Suit By Summons
1-4-13: Administrative Process For Ordinance Violations
1-4-1: PENALTY:
Any person convicted of a violation of any section of this code, including the
doing of any act which is prohibited or the failure to do any required act as
set forth under this code, shall be fined in a sum not less than three hundred
fifty dollars ($350.00) and not to exceed seven hundred fifty dollars ($750.00)
for each violation, excepting any violation of a section of this code wherein
the fine is specifically set forth. A separate offense shall be deemed
committed for each day any violation of any provision of this code or any
ordinance shall continue. Additionally, any such person convicted of a
violation of any section of this code may, in addition to any fine imposed for
the violation, be required to perform a reasonable number of hours of public
service which may include picking up litter in public parks or along public
highways or maintaining any public facility. (Ord. 2014-05, 6-16-2014)
1-4-2: LICENSE:
When a person is convicted of a violation of any section of this code, any
license previously issued him by the village may be revoked by the court or by
the board of trustees. (1974 Code)
1-4-3: APPLICATION:
The penalty provided in this chapter shall be applicable to every section in
this code the same as though it were a part of each and every separate section.
Any person convicted of a violation of any section of this code where any duty
is prescribed or obligation imposed, or where any act which is of a continuing
nature or declared to be unlawful, shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor. A
separate offense shall be deemed committed upon each day such duty or
obligation remains unperformed or such act continues, unless otherwise
specifically provided in this code.
In all cases where the same offense is made punishable or is created by
different clauses or sections of this code the prosecuting officer may elect
under which to proceed; but not more than one recovery shall be had against the
same person for the same offense; provided, that the revocation of a license or
permit shall not be considered a recovery or penalty so as to bar any other
penalty being enforced.
Whenever the doing of any act or the omission to do any act constitutes a
breach of any section or provision of this code and there shall be no fine or
penalty specifically declared for such breach, the provisions of this chapter
shall apply and a separate offense shall be deemed committed upon each day
during or on which a breach or violation occurs or continues. (1974 Code)
1-4-4: LIABILITY OF OFFICERS:
No provision of this code designating the duties of any officer or employee
shall be so construed as to make such officer or employee liable for any fine
or penalty provided for a failure to perform such duty, unless the intention of
the board of trustees to impose such fine or penalty on such officer or
employee is specifically and clearly expressed in the section creating the
duty. (1974 Code)
1-4-5: ACTION BEFORE PROPER OFFICER:
All actions brought to recover any fine or to enforce any penalty for a
violation of any provision of this code, shall be begun before the proper
officer and shall be brought in the corporate name of the village as plaintiff.
No prosecution, recovery or acquittal for the violation of any code provision
shall constitute a defense to any other prosecution of the same party for any
other violation of such code provision, although the different causes of action
existed at the same time, and, if united, would not have exceeded the
jurisdiction of the court. In addition to the ability to initiate court action,
the village may bring such action to recover any fine or to enforce any penalty
for a violation of any provision of this code through the administrative
process set forth in section
1-4-13 of this chapter. If action taken under section
1-4-13 of this chapter is concluded by the full payment of a fine by the
offender within the specified time period, the village shall not bring any
other action for the specified violation through court proceedings. (Ord. 2002-
15, 8-19-2002)
1-4-6: SUMMONS; WARRANT; COMPLAINT:
In all actions for violation of any code provisions, the first process shall be
summons; and it shall not be necessary to file a complaint in writing prior to
issuing the same; provided however, that a warrant for the arrest of the
offender may issue in the first instance upon the affidavit of any person that
such code provision has been violated, and that the person making the complaint
has reasonable grounds to believe that the person charged is guilty thereof.
Every person arrested upon such warrant shall, without unnecessary delay, be
tried for the alleged offense. However, this section shall not apply if action
is first taken by the village under the administrative process set forth in
section
1-4-13 of this chapter for a violation of this code and properly concluded
under that section. (Ord. 2002-15, 8-19-2002)
1-4-7: CONTENTS OF WARRANT:
All warrants issued by virtue of the foregoing section shall state, or recite
briefly, the allegations of the complaint, and shall be directed to any
constable of Woodford County. The officer receiving such warrant shall
immediately arrest the person against whom the warrant is issued and bring such
person before the proper court issuing the same for trial, unless such arrest
shall be made in the nighttime or upon Sunday, in which case such officer may
detain the person in custody until he can be brought before such court. (R.O.
1908, Ord. 15; amd. 1974 Code; Ord. 79-3, 5-7-1979, eff. 5-8-1979)
1-4-8: PROCEED WITH TRIAL:
In case the officer issuing the warrant is, on account of sickness or other
cause, unable to attend the trial of said offender, it shall be the duty of the
officer having the custody of the person arrested to convey him to the nearest
proper county officer for trial, and without unnecessary delay, proceed with
the trial of such person in the same manner as if warrant had been issued by
said officer. (R.O. 1908, Ord. 15; amd. 1974 Code; Ord. 79-3, 5-7-1979, eff. 5-
8-1979)
1-4-9: ENTER JUDGMENT:
Upon the person so arrested being produced before him, the proper officer shall
proceed with the examination or trial without unnecessary delay, and shall
immediately upon conviction enter judgment against the defendant in favor of
the village for the amount of fine or penalty and costs of prosecution and
order such person to be committed until such fine or penalty and costs are
paid. (R.O. 1908, Ord. 15; amd. 1974 Code)
1-4-10: ARREST WITHOUT A WARRANT:
In all cases where any person is arrested on view, without a warrant, the
officer making the arrest, without unnecessary delay, shall take such person
before the proper officer who shall proceed to hear and determine the matter,
as in other cases. (R.O. 1908, Ord. 15; amd. 1974 Code)
1-4-11: EXECUTION OF DUTY:
All village officers shall, unless otherwise directed by this or some other
village code provision, proceed in the execution of their duty in the same
manner as such officers are required to proceed under the laws of the state in
similar cases, and all general laws in force and relating to proceedings in
action before the proper officer, and the duties of marshals are hereby
declared to be in force in the village for the government of such officers in
the discharge of their duties. (R.O. 1908, Ord. 15; amd. 1974 Code)
1-4-12: SUIT BY SUMMONS:
When suit to recover any fine or penalty is begun by summons, it shall be in
the ordinary form of summons in civil actions, except that it shall state the
code provision violated and the particular breach thereof, which summons shall
be served and trial and subsequent proceedings had as in other civil
proceedings had before the proper officer. (R.O. 1908, Ord. 15; amd. 1974 Code)
1-4-13: ADMINISTRATIVE PROCESS FOR ORDINANCE VIOLATIONS:
   (A)   Any village officer authorized to enforce the provisions of this code,
including any law enforcement officer acting on behalf of the village and the
code official as set forth in section
7-4-13 of this code, may issue and serve administrative enforcement citations
to an offender for a violation of this code. Furthermore, the village clerk may
issue administrative enforcement citations by certified mail to the offender.
   (B)   Every administrative enforcement citation issued under this provision
shall impose a fine of one hundred dollars ($100.00) to be paid to the village
of Roanoke, unless the code provision specifically provides a lesser fine, in
which case the maximum fine specifically set forth in such code provision shall
be paid to the village of Roanoke. A fine of two hundred dollars ($200.00)
shall be imposed for a second violation of the same code provision by the same
person or responsible party within a twelve (12) month period beginning on the
date of the first violation of the particular code provision. A fine of three
hundred dollars ($300.00) shall be imposed for a third or subsequent violation
of the same code provision by the same person or responsible party within a
twelve (12) month period beginning on the date of the first violation of the
particular code provision. If a provision of this code provides for a penalty
of less than one hundred dollars ($100.00) for a first offense charged as an
administrative enforcement action under this section, then the specific fine
amount set forth for a first offense shall be doubled for a second offense and
tripled for a third or subsequent offense during the twelve (12) month period
as described above in this section. Payment of any fine under this section
shall be made to the village clerk at the village hall. Any check tendered to
pay a fine under this section which is returned to village unpaid for any
reason shall not be considered to be "full payment" under this section.
   (C)   The offender shall pay any fine imposed under this section within
thirty (30) calendar days, unless a shorter period of time is specifically
provided by the applicable code provision. If the fine imposed under this
provision is not paid within the required thirty (30) day period, the fine
shall increase as provided herein. If the fine is imposed for a first violation
within a twelve (12) month period and is not paid within the required thirty
(30) day period, the fine shall be increased to two hundred fifty dollars
($250.00) to be paid to the village, regardless of the amount of the fine for
this initial offense in a twelve (12) month period if the fine was paid during
the required thirty (30) day period. If the fine is imposed for a second
violation within a twelve (12) month period and is not paid within the required
thirty (30) day period, the fine shall be increased to three hundred fifty
dollars ($350.00) to be paid to the village, regardless of the amount of the
fine for this second offense in a twelve (12) month period. If the fine is
imposed for a third or subsequent violation within a twelve (12) month period
and is not paid within the required thirty (30) day period, the fine shall be
increased to four hundred fifty dollars ($450.00) to be paid to the village,
regardless of the amount of the fine for this third or subsequent offense in a
twelve (12) month period.
   (D)   This administrative enforcement process shall not initiate any court
proceedings related to a particular violation of this code and shall be
independent of any court proceeding related to the enforcement of this code.
Furthermore, action taken under this section shall not prevent the village from
pursuing other types of enforcement action against the offender or another
person for the same violation. However, any violation of this code which is
concluded by the full payment of the fine amount set forth above by the
offender in the specified time period shall not be brought by the village as an
action against that offender to recover a fine for such violation in a court
proceeding. (Ord. 2003-12, 10-20-2003; amd. Ord. 2019-02, 3-4-2019)
CHAPTER 5
BOARD OF TRUSTEES
SECTION:
1-5-1: Board Meetings
1-5-2: Appointment Of Committees
1-5-3: Rules
1-5-4: Order Of Business
1-5-5: Passage Of Ordinances
1-5-6: Requested Village Action; Payment Of Legal Fees
1-5-1: BOARD MEETINGS:
   (A)   Time Of Meetings: The regular and special meetings of the Board of
Trustees shall be held at Village Hall, located at 101 North Main in the
Village of Roanoke. Regular meetings shall be held on the first and third
Monday of each month at seven o'clock (7:00) P.M., except when such date shall
fall on a holiday, when such meeting shall be held on the Tuesday immediately
following the first or third Monday of the month at seven o'clock (7:00) P.M.
   (B)   Special Meetings: The Village Board may prescribe, by ordinance, the
time of the Board meetings, and the manner in which special Board meetings may
be called. The President or any three (3) Trustees may call special meetings of
the Village Board by leaving with the Village Clerk written notice of the date
and hour of holding such special meeting, and for the purpose of which such
special meeting is called. The Village Clerk shall immediately issue a written
notice of such meeting to each member of the Board and further post and provide
public notice of such meeting in a timely manner as required by Illinois law.
   (C)   Salaries: The amount paid to Trustees for their service will be one
hundred dollars ($100.00) per month. This amount shall constitute the entire
compensation for Trustees for any and all full Board meetings attended and for
other duties of Trustees conducted on behalf of the Village.
In addition, the amount paid to Trustees shall be fifty dollars ($50.00) for
every committee meeting attended. Multiple committee meetings held on any
particular evening will be considered one meeting for the purpose of
determining compensation.
These salaries shall be effective for Board members taking office after May 1,
2011.
   (D)   Claims Paid In Vacation:
      1.   General: During the time period between regular Village Board
meetings, the appropriate Village officials can pay certain routine bills and
invoices on behalf of the Village when these routine bills and invoices are
provided to the Village for services or items received by the Village. Such
routine bills and invoices that are paid in this manner shall be considered as
"claims paid in vacation", such that the Village can continue regular business
operations during the time period between regular Village Board meetings.
Subject to approval by the Village President, the following listing of routine
bills and invoices shall be considered matters that can be paid by the Village
as a "claim paid in vacation":
         Employee health insurance plan premiums.
         Employee uniforms.
         Engineering services.
         Fuel charges for Village vehicles.
         Garbage collection services.
         Gas and electric utilities.
         Internet service.
         Legal services.
         Phone service.
         Policing and dispatch services.
         Regular building cleaning services.
         Regular chemicals and operating supplies for water and sewage
treatment systems and facilities.
         Regular employee wages and salaries.
         Regular operating supplies for Ambulance Department.
         Regular operating supplies for Street Department.
         Regular periodic water testing and monitoring services.
         Security and alarm services.
      2.   Committee Approval: Between regular Village Board meetings, a
committee Chairperson shall have the authority to approve an expenditure of up
to one thousand five hundred dollars ($1,500.00) per expenditure, which shall
include the payment of the bill or invoice for such expenditure, for matters
under the direct authority of the committee Chairperson. The payment of any
expenditure under this provision shall be included with the other "claims paid
in vacation" for the next regular Village Board meeting.
      3.   Village Board Approval: All "claims paid in vacation" shall be
presented to the Village Board and Village President for review and final
approval at the next regular Village Board meeting and such "claims paid in
vacation" shall be listed as a separate agenda item and action item at this
next regular Village Board meeting.
   3.   Village Board Approval: All "claims paid in vacation" shall be
presented to the Village Board and Village President for review and final
approval at the next regular Village Board meeting and such "claims paid in
vacation" shall be listed as a separate agenda item and action item at this
next regular Village Board meeting.
   (E)   Electronic Participation at Village Board Meetings:
      1.   Subject to the provisions of this section, a Village Board member
may electronically attend any open or closed meeting of the Village Board via
telephone, video, internet connection, or other electronic technology which
allows effective audio interaction with the Board member from a remote
location. Except as otherwise provided in Part G of this section, a Board
member may electronically attend a meeting of the Village Board only under the
following conditions:
         (a)   The Board member must notify the Village Clerk (or designee) as
soon as practicable before the meeting of the Board member's request to
electronically attend the meeting so that necessary communications equipment
can be made available.
         (b)   The Board member must assert one or more of the following
reasons why the Board member is unable to physically attend the Village Board
meeting and explain to the Village Clerk (or designee) the factual basis for
that assertion:
            (1)   The Board member cannot attend due to the Board member's
illness or disability; or
            (2)   The Board member cannot attend because of conflicting
obligations to the Board member's employer or is engaged in business on behalf
of the Village; or
            (3)   The Board member cannot attend because of a family or other
emergency.
         (c)   Any Board member participating electronically and those members
of the Village Board who are physically present at the site of the meeting must
have the capability during the meeting to effectively and instantaneously
engage in interactive communication with each other. During open meetings,
members of the audience must have the capability to hear all audio interactions
among all the members of the Village Board who are present either physically or
electronically at the open Board meeting.
      2.   Upon receiving a request from a Village Trustee to electronically
attend a Village Board meeting, the Village Clerk (or designee) shall promptly
inform the Village President of that request prior to the Board meeting. Upon
receiving a request from the Village President to electronically attend a
Village Board meeting, the Village Clerk (or designee) shall promptly inform
the most senior Village Trustee who will be attending the Board meeting.
      3.   A quorum of the Village Board must be physically present at the
scheduled meeting location in order to take the necessary action to allow a
Board member to electronically attend that Village Board meeting.
      4.   After taking roll call at the Board meeting at which the Board
member requests to electronically attend and before any action is taken by the
Village Board, the request to electronically attend a Village Board meeting
shall be the first order of business to be considered by the Board members
physically present at the Board meeting in accordance with the following
procedures:
         (a)   After establishing that a quorum is physically present at the
Board meeting at which the Board member desires to electronically attend and
establishing that the communications equipment necessary to permit electronical
participation is functioning properly, the Village President, or the presiding
officer if the Village President is not present, shall state that:
            (1)   A Board member has requested permission to electronically
attend the meeting, and
            (2)    The Board member will be authorized to electronically attend
the meeting unless a motion objecting to the member's electronic attendance is
made, seconded, and adopted by a two-thirds majority of the members of the
Village Board physically present at the meeting.
         (b)   If a motion objecting to the Board member's participation is
made and approved by a two-thirds majority of the members of the Village Board
physically present at the meeting, the member making the request may not
electronically attend the meeting. If no such motion is made and seconded or if
any such motion is made and seconded but not approved by a two-thirds majority
of the members of the Village Board physically present at the meeting, then the
request by the member to electronically attend the meeting shall be deemed
approved by the Village Board, and the Village President or other presiding
officer shall declare that the requesting member is present at the Board
meeting. After such declaration by the Village President or presiding officer,
the ability of the Board member to electronically participate in that Board
meeting may not be withdrawn for the remainder of that meeting.
         (c)   As an alternative to the procedure under parts 1 and 2 of this
subsection D of Section 2.08.140, a simple majority vote of the members of the
Village Board physically present at the Village Board meeting to allow
attendance by the non-physically present Board member will authorize the
electronic attendance of this Board member at that Village Board meeting under
the terms and conditions otherwise set forth herein.
      5.   The minutes of any meeting during which a Board member
electronically attends shall identify any such member as attending by
electronic means.
      6.   A Board member permitted to electronically attend a Village Board
meeting shall have the authority to participate in the meeting to the same
extent as those members physically present, subject to the same limitations
applicable to those members physically present. A Board member attending
electronically may leave a meeting and return to the same extent and under the
same conditions as members who are physically present, provided the member
attending electronically shall announce when leaving and returning to the
meeting.
      7.   The Village Board may electronically hold any open or closed meeting
via telephone, video, internet connection, or other electronic technology which
allows for effective audio or video conferencing between the Board members from
remote locations when the Governor or the Director of the Illinois Department
of Public Health has issued a disaster declaration related to public health
concerns that covers the Village of Roanoke and that limits attendance at
public meetings, and all of the following additional conditions have been met:
         (a)   The Village President has issued a declaration that in-person
public meetings are not practical or prudent because of the declared disaster;
         (b)   All members of the Village Board participating in the meeting
can hear each other and can hear all discussion and testimony during the
meeting;
         (c)   All members of the public can contemporaneously hear all
discussion, discussion, testimony, and votes taken during the open portion of
the meeting;
         (d)   At least one member of the Village Board or the Village Clerk or
the Village Attorney is present at the regular meeting location unless not
feasible because of the declared disaster;
         (e)   Notice is provided to the public that the meeting will be held
by electronic means, including information on how the public can electronically
attend the open portion of the meeting;
         (f)   All votes of the Village Board are taken by roll call vote;
         (g)   The Village has complied with all meeting notice requirements
under the Open Meetings Act while also posting such meeting notices on the
Village's website; and
         (h)   A verbatim record of all portions of the meeting is maintained
by the Village in an audio or video recording. (Ord. 2017-09, 7-5-2017; amd.
Ord. 2021-06, 9-7-2021)
1-5-2: APPOINTMENT OF COMMITTEES:
   (A)   The Village President shall, at the first regular meeting of the Board
in May after the consolidated election at which any Trustees and the President
are seated and commence their terms in office, or as soon thereafter as
convenient, appoint, with the advice and consent of the Board, the following
committees, consisting of three (3) Trustees each: Finance and Offices
(includes Appropriations and Claims); Public Safety and Insurance; Streets,
Alleys, and Ordinances; Village Property/Light and Power; Local and Industrial
Improvement; Personnel; Liquor Commission and License; Board of Health;
Waterworks and Sewer; and Ambulance and Civil Defense. At this same time, the
Village President shall also appoint, with the consent of the Village Board,
the ESDA Director, the Zoning Officer, and any members of the Joint Zoning and
Planning Board whose terms of office have expired.
Each of said committees shall have jurisdiction over all matters indicated in
the name and title of said committee, and over such other matters as may from
time to time be specially and specifically referred to it by the Board.
Vacancies occurring in such committees may be filled at any time by the Village
President, with the advice and consent of the Trustees, as in the original
appointment of the committee. The first member named in each committee shall
act as Chairman thereof.
   (B)   All special committees shall be appointed by the Village President
with the concurrence and consent of the Board of Trustees.
   (C)   All reports of committees shall be addressed to the "President and
Board of Trustees of the Village of Roanoke". Said report shall briefly
describe the matter referred and the conclusion to which the committee has
arrived after careful investigation and study of the matter referred, and said
report should be accompanied by a recommendation from the committee as to which
course of action should be pursued by the Board relative to such matter. Each
committee shall attach to such report all resolutions, petitions,
remonstrances, and other materials or documents in their possession relative to
the subject matter of the report so that the President and Trustees can act
advisedly with regard to such matter.
The President and Board of Trustees hereby agree that the names of various
committee members will not be published in this Code annually due to the
constantly changing nature of the makeup of each committee. In the alternative,
the President and Board of Trustees of the Village will maintain an up-to-date
list of committee members with the Village Clerk. The Village Clerk is hereby
instructed and empowered to place a copy of said up to date listing of the
various committees and the persons serving on those committees on the Village
website and on the Village bulletin board which can be viewed by the public at
any time. (Ord. 2011-03, 6-6-2011; amd. Ord. 2022-02, 1-17-2022)
1-5-3: RULES:
The following rules shall govern the Board in its actions and deliberations:
   Rule 1. A majority of all the Trustees elected shall constitute a quorum.
   Rule 2. In the absence of the President, the Board may elect one of their
number President Pro Tem and the appointment of such member to the Chair shall
not deprive him of his vote on any question which may come before the Board for
decision.
   Rule 3. The vote of the president shall be cast to decide all tie votes
should he see fit to cast said vote.
   Rule 4. All questions relating to priority of business shall be decided
without debate.
   Rule 5. While a member is addressing the board, no other member shall carry
on any private conversation or pass between the speaker and the chair.
   Rule 6. When a member desires to speak he shall address the presiding
officer as "Mr. President", and then, if recognized, he may proceed with his
remarks.
   Rule 7. No member shall be permitted to leave the boardroom during a session
without the consent either of the president or of the board.
   Rule 8. A member when called to order, unless allowed by the board to
explain, shall immediately sit down. If no appeal be taken, the decision of the
chair shall be conclusive, but if the decision of the chair be appealed from,
the question shall be put to the board, without debate, as follows: "Shall the
decision of the chair be sustained?".
   Rule 9. Every member who shall be present when a question is stated by the
chair, must vote thereon, unless he be interested or excused from voting by the
board.
   Rule 10. Every motion if required by any member, shall be reduced to
writing, and no motion shall be put or debated until it be seconded.
   Rule 11. When a question is before the board no motion shall be in order but
the following:
      1.   To adjourn.
      2.   To lay on the table.
      3.   The previous question.
      4.   To postpone indefinitely.
      5.   To postpone to certain date.
      6.   To commit or to refer.
      7.   To amend.
These motions shall have precedence in the order stated in the rule, and a
motion to adjourn, to lay on the table, and for the previous question, shall be
decided without debate.
   Rule 12. A motion to adjourn shall always be in order, except:
      1.   When a member has the floor.
      2.   When a vote is being taken.
      3.   When adjournment was the last preceding motion.
   Rule 13. Whenever a resolution or motion is offered by a member, the name of
the member offering the same must be entered on the minutes.
   Rule 14. When a blank is to be filled, and different sums or times are
proposed, the question shall first be put upon the largest sum and the longest
time.
   Rule 15. No vote of the village board shall be reconsidered or rescinded at
a special meeting, unless at such special meeting there shall be present as
many members as attended the meeting when the original vote was taken.
   Rule 16. No person except a member of the board shall be permitted to
address the same without the consent of two- thirds (2/3) of the members
present.
   Rule 17. The president, or president pro tem, shall decide all questions of
order, and when the rules herein specified and provided are not sufficient, or
do not bear upon the point, then reference shall be had to Robert's manual, and
the rules therein shall prevail.
   Rule 18. The president shall preserve order and decorum, and if any member
of the board transgresses the rules herein, the president shall, or any member
may, call him to order; and if he refuses to take his seat or persists in
behaving in a discourteous manner, or uses improper language, the president may
appoint one or more sergeants at arms from the members of the board who shall
have power to compel obedience and eject such unruly member from the place of
meeting unless he complies with the rules.
   Rule 19. An appeal may be taken from the decision of the chair on any
question whatever by any member of the board, and the question shall then be
put without debate, by the clerk, as follows: "Shall the decision of the chair
be sustained?". And if a majority of the members present vote nay on such
question, the decision of the chair shall be overruled and so entered by the
clerk in the journal.
   Rule 20. The foregoing rules shall not be repealed, amended nor suspended,
except by a majority vote of the board, and it shall be the duty of the village
clerk to read these rules at the first regular meeting of the new board after
the annual election in each year.
   Rule 21. The yeas and nays shall be called on the request of any member of
the board, upon any question whatsoever, pending before the board, and such
request may be made, either before or after the taking of any viva voce vote on
such question. (Ord. 2014-05, 6-16-2014)
1-5-4: ORDER OF BUSINESS:
The regular order of business and rules of procedure shall in all cases be
adhered to, except when temporarily suspended by a two-thirds (2/3) vote of all
the members present. The board shall proceed to transact the business before
them in the following order:
   (A)   Roll call.
   (B)   Reading of the minutes of last meeting, their amendment, if necessary,
and approval.
   (C)   Report of village officers.
   (D)   Communications and bills to the board.
   (E)   Report of standing committees.
   (F)   Report of special committees.
   (G)   Hearing of petitions.
   (H)   Unfinished business.
   (I)   New business.
   (J)   Ordinances, resolutions and other business not otherwise provided for.
(R.O. 1908, Ord. 2)
1-5-5: PASSAGE OF ORDINANCES:
The yeas and nays shall be taken upon the passage of all ordinances and upon
all propositions before the board to create any liability against the village,
or where the proposition is for the expenditure or appropriation of its money,
which shall be entered on its record of its proceedings, and a concurrence of a
majority of its members elected to the board shall be necessary for the passage
of any such ordinance or proposition. (R.O. 1908, Ord. 2)
1-5-6: REQUESTED VILLAGE ACTION; PAYMENT OF LEGAL FEES:
   (A)   When the Village is contacted by a person, organization, or other
entity to undertake a project or action that primarily benefits the requesting
party, the requesting party shall be required to reimburse the Village for
legal fees and costs incurred by the Village for undertaking the requested
project or action. The Village shall make an assessment when initially
contacted by the requesting party as to whether the requested project or action
primarily benefits the requesting party and has little to no benefit for the
Village or whether the requested project or action does benefit the Village.
This determination of whether the requested project or action primarily
benefits the requesting party shall be in the sole discretion of the Village
Board. When the Village makes a determination that the requesting party will be
responsible for reimbursing the Village for legal fees and costs incurred by
the Village for undertaking and completing the requested project or action, the
Village shall promptly provide written notice to the requesting party of this
determination and obligation to reimburse the Village. The legal fees shall be
based upon the rates paid by the Village to the Village's Attorney at the time
the requested project or action is completed.
   (B)   Village projects or actions covered by this Section shall include, but
not be limited to, preparation of a Village ordinance, resolution, or motion
and any supporting documents, preparation of contracts or agreements in any
form and any supporting documents, and document recording or filing with a
governmental unit or the State of Illinois.
   (C)   Village projects or actions covered by this Section shall be
contingent upon and shall not become final until the required reimbursement
under this Section has been received by the Village.
   (D)   When the Village has determined that the requesting party will be
responsible for reimbursing the Village for any legal fees and costs incurred
by the Village for undertaking and completing the requested project or action
as provided herein, the requesting party shall reimburse the Village in full
for such legal fees and costs within thirty (30) days after receiving written
notice from the Village of these fees and costs. The written notice shall
deemed to have been received by the requesting party when the requesting party
is personally served with the notice, on the date when the notice is emailed by
the Village Clerk to the requesting party at the email address provided by the
requesting party, or three (3) days after such notice is mailed by regular
first-class U.S. mail by the Village Clerk to the mailing address provided by
the requesting party.
   (E)   The Village, at the Village's discretion, may require a deposit from
the requesting party before undertaking the requested project or action. The
Village shall determine the deposit amount when the request is made to the
Village based upon the type of project or action requested and the anticipated
legal services to complete the requested project or action. If a deposit is
collected by the Village under this Section, the deposit shall be applied to
the Village's legal fees and costs when the requested project or action is
completed. The requesting party shall be responsible for reimbursing the
Village as provided in this Section for any shortfall between the deposit and
the final total cost for the requested project or action. The Village shall
promptly return to the requesting party any remaining portion of the deposit
after the Village's costs have been paid as provided herein.
   (F)   Any person or entity violating any provision of this Section shall be
punished by a fine as provided under the general penalty provisions of this
Village Code (Chapter 4 of Title 1, as amended from time to time), which shall
include a failure to pay reimbursement to the Village as provided in this
Section. (Ord. 2019-14, 10-21-2019)
CHAPTER 6
VILLAGE OFFICERS
SECTION:

1-6-17: Village Collector
1-6-18: Reports

1-6-20: Removal Of Appointed Officers

1-6-1: ELECTION OF OFFICERS:
   (A)   There shall be elected in and for the village one president, one clerk
and six (6) trustees, all and each of them for the term of four (4) years, with
the trustees' terms to be staggered. Said election shall be held on the day
appointed by statute. (R.O. 1908, Ord. 18; amd. 1974 Code)
   (B)   The elected municipal officials of the village shall take office on
the first monthly meeting of the month of May immediately following the
proclamation of the results of the municipal election. (Ord. 1981-2, 3-16-1981)
1-6-2: VILLAGE PRESIDENT:
   (A)   President Of Village Board: The village president shall act as
president of the board of trustees in compliance with the provisions of the
Illinois municipal code.
   (B)   Salary:
      1.   Through May 2017, when the new village president is sworn into
office, the amount paid to the village president for each meeting of the board
of trustees of the village, whether or not the meeting is actually attended by
the president, will be seventy five dollars ($75.00) per meeting.
      2.   Beginning in May 2017, after the new village president is sworn into
office, the village president shall receive a salary of three hundred fifty
dollars ($350.00) per month.
      3.   The compensation level for the village president shall not be
increased or decreased during the fiscal year for which the annual
appropriation has been made. Further, the compensation level for the village
president shall not be increased or decreased during the village president's
term of office, but may be increased or decreased for a future term of office
for the village president if done so at least one hundred eighty (180) days
prior to the beginning of such future term. (Ord. 2015-18, 11-2-2015)
1-6-3: APPOINTMENT OF OFFICERS:
The president of the board of trustees shall, annually after the regular
village election, or as soon thereafter as may be, appoint by and with the
advice and consent of the board, one village treasurer, one street commissioner
and one water and sewer commissioner. (R.O. 1908, Ord. 19; amd. 1974 Code; Ord.
79-3, 5-7-1979, eff. 5-8-1979)
1-6-4: BOARD TO FILL VACANCIES:
Whenever any vacancy occurs in any office filled by appointment, the president
and members of the board of trustees shall immediately proceed to fill such
vacancy in the manner hereinbefore provided in section
1-6-3 of this chapter. (R.O. 1908, Ord. 19)
1-6-5: TERM OF OFFICE:
All officers of the Village shall hold their respective offices for and during
the respective terms for which they are elected or appointed, and until their
successors are elected or appointed and qualified. (R.O. 1908, Ord. 19)
1-6-6: OATH OF OFFICE:
All officers of the Village, either elected or appointed, shall, before
entering upon the duties of their respective offices, take and subscribe the
following oath or affirmation:
I do solemnly swear (or affirm) that I will support the Constitution of the
United States, and the Constitution of the State of Illinois, and that I will
faithfully discharge the duties of the office of            according to the
best of my ability;
which oath or affirmation so subscribed shall be filed in the office of the
Village Clerk and copied upon the records of the Village. (R.O. 1908, Ord. 19)
1-6-7: BONDS:
   (A)   All officers of the Village, except Trustees, shall, before entering
upon the duties of their respective offices, execute a bond, with security, to
be approved by the President and Board of Trustees, payable to the Village,
conditioned for the faithful performance of the duties of their respective
offices, and for the payment of all moneys received by them, according to law
and the provisions of this Code.
   (B)   The bond of the Treasurer shall be in the penal sum of three thousand
dollars ($3,000.00), which may be increased at the beginning of each fiscal
year, as the President and Board of Trustees may determine. Provided however,
that in no case shall the Treasurer's bond be fixed at a less sum than the
amount of the estimated tax and special assessments for the current year. Bonds
of other officers shall be as follows: (R.O. 1908, Ord. 19)
   Street Commissioner   $ 500.00
   Village Clerk   500.00
   Village Collector   1,000.00
(R.O. 1908, Ord. 19; amd. Ord. 177, 10-29-1940; Ord. 79-3, 5-7-1979, eff. 5-8-
1979 at 6:00 A.M.; Ord. 1998-09, 11-2-1998)
   (C)   No person holding any Village office shall be taken as surety upon any
bond payable to the Village.
   (D)   All bonds required by this Chapter shall be filed with the Village
Clerk except the bond of the Village Clerk, which shall be filed with the
Village Treasurer, and all bonds shall be copied upon the records of the
Village. (R.O. 1908, Ord. 19)
1-6-8: COMPENSATION:
The compensation to be paid the various elected or appointed officers shall be
set from time to time by the President and Board of Trustees. (1974 Code)
1-6-9: OFFICERS COMMISSIONED:
After taking the oath and filing the bond as aforesaid, and before entering
upon the duties of their respective offices, all Village officers, except the
Trustees and Clerk, shall be commissioned by warrant, under the Corporate Seal,
signed by the President and attested by the Clerk. The President of the Board
of Trustees shall issue a certificate of election, underneath the Corporate
Seal, to the Clerk. (R.O. 1908, Ord. 19; amd. 1974 Code)
1-6-10: ELIGIBILITY TO OFFICE:
No person shall be eligible to any office in the Village who is not a qualified
elector of the Village, according to the provisions of this Code on elections,
and who has not resided therein for one year next prior to his election or
appointment. (R.O. 1908, Ord. 19; amd. 1974 Code)
1-6-11: PLACE OF MEETINGS:
The Board of Trustees shall provide a place for the meetings of the Board and
shall also furnish the necessary books and blanks for the use of the officers
of the Village and all necessary stationery, lights and fuel for the use of the
President and Board of Trustees. And the President and Board of Trustees may,
in their discretion, employ legal counsel for the current year, or from time to
time during such year as they may deem necessary. (R.O. 1908, Ord. 19; amd.
1974 Code)
1-6-12: VILLAGE CLERK:
   (A)   Duties:
      1.   The village clerk shall attend all meetings of the board of
trustees, and keep a correct record of all the proceedings of the same in a
suitable book kept for that purpose.
      2.   The village clerk shall keep the corporate seal, provided under the
direction of the board of trustees, and all books, papers and documents
belonging to the village, not belonging to some other officer.
      3.   The village clerk shall notify all committees appointed by the
president or board of trustees of their appointment and of the business
referred to them.
      4.   The village clerk shall maintain duplicate receipts, warrants, and
vouchers received from the village treasurer.
      5.   The village clerk shall, at the first meeting of the board each
month, give all monthly reports required by law and/or ordinance.
      6.   The village clerk shall record in a book to be kept for that purpose
all ordinances passed by the board of trustees, and at the foot of each
ordinance so recorded, the village clerk shall make a memorandum of the date of
the passage and, when required by law or ordinance, the date of the publication
of the same.
      7.   The village clerk shall index all ordinances by their titles, keep a
list of all committees appointed and of the business referred to them,
respectively, and shall note when committees report and the date and nature of
their report.
      8.   The village clerk shall attest all deeds, contracts and leases made
by the president, and board of trustees and in conjunction with the president,
sign all ordinances, bonds, leases and orders on the village treasurer, and
affix the corporate seal thereto, and perform such other and further duties as
may be required by law and said board.
      9.   When required by law, the village clerk shall cause ordinances,
approved and adopted by the board, to be either: a) printed or published in
book or pamphlet form and maintained at the village hall for public inspection,
or b) published within thirty (30) days after passage in a newspaper published
in the village, or if a newspaper is not published in the village, then in a
newspaper with general circulation in the village.
      10.   The village clerk shall immediately, upon receipt of the
treasurer's annual report, maintain a copy of the report and cause the same to
be published in a newspaper published in the village, or if a newspaper is not
published in the village, then in a newspaper with general circulation in the
village.
   (B)   Salary: The salary of the position of village clerk shall be set and
established by the village board by means of an ordinance and such salary shall
not be increased or diminished during the village clerk's elective term of
office. Such salary may only be changed or adjusted for the next elective term
by an ordinance passed at least one hundred eighty (180) days prior to the
beginning of a new elective term for the village clerk. (Ord. 2002-16, 10-7-
2002)
1-6-13: VILLAGE TREASURER:
   (A)   Duties:
      1.   The village treasurer shall receive all monies belonging to the
village, and shall allow disbursement of the same only upon an appropriate
warrant that is in compliance with the other provisions of this code.
      2.   The village treasurer shall keep a full and accurate account of all
monies received and disbursed on behalf of the village, with date of receipt
and disbursement, from whom received and to whom disbursed, and from what fund
received and disbursed. The village treasurer shall keep a separate account of
each fund or appropriation, and the debits and credits belonging to each fund
or appropriation.
      3.   The village treasurer shall render an account to the board of
trustees at the end of every month, and more often if required by the board,
under oath, showing the state of the treasury and the balance of money in the
treasury, together with a statement of all money received, on what account, all
warrants redeemed and paid. This account shall be presented to the board no
later than the second board meeting during the month following the month for
which the account is rendered. Upon the presentation of this accounting, all
warrants and vouchers held by the village treasurer, along with a copy of the
monthly account, shall be delivered to the village clerk and filed in the
clerk's office. The village treasurer shall maintain a register of all warrants
paid, describing them and showing date, amount, number, the fund from which
paid, to whom and when paid.
      4.   Within six (6) months after the end of each fiscal year, the village
treasurer shall prepare and file with the village clerk a detailed account of
all receipts and expenditures, and of all transactions during the preceding
fiscal year. Within this same time period, the village treasurer shall also
file this account, along with a certification from the village clerk that this
annual account has been properly published, with the village collector and the
Woodford County collector.
      5.   The village treasurer shall hold all funds received for a special
assessment in a separate account for each separate special assessment, and the
funds held in the special assessment account shall be used for no other purpose
except for reimbursement for funds expended for improvements associated with
the special assessment.
      6.   The village treasurer shall deposit village funds in a manner and in
such depositories as directed by the board of trustees. Additionally, the
village treasurer shall keep all village money and funds separate and distinct
from his own, and shall not intermingle his own money with or make private or
personal use of village funds.
   (B)   Salary: The salary or remuneration paid to the village treasurer for
the performance of duties required by that office shall be set and established
by the village board by means of a resolution or motion without the necessity
of an amending ordinance, but such motion or resolution shall require the same
number of votes for its adoption or passage as an ordinance would require. Such
salary or remuneration may be changed or adjusted from time to time in the same
manner. (Ord. 2002-16, 10-7-2002)
1-6-14: CHIEF OF POLICE:
(Rep. by Ord. 79-3, 5-7-1979, eff. 5-8-1979)
1-6-15: WATER AND SEWER COMMISSIONER:
The water and sewer commissioner shall supervise the operation and maintenance
of the water and sewer systems of the village and shall report monthly to the
board of trustees the conditions of said systems and shall perform such other
duties as may be required by law and the provisions of this code. (Ord. 46, 6-
16-1908; amd. 1974 Code)
1-6-16: STREET COMMISSIONER:
It shall be the duty of the street commissioner to superintend, under the
direction of the street and alley committee, the opening, altering, closing,
grading, repairing, planking, paving and cleaning of all streets, alleys and
avenues within the village and the constructing, grading and repairing of all
sidewalks, sewers and street crossings in the village, and perform such other
duties as may be required by law and the provisions of this code. (Ord. 46, 6-
16-1908)
The president of the board of trustees shall have the power to suspend the
street commissioner. (R.O. 1908, Ord. 19)
1-6-17: VILLAGE COLLECTOR:
   (A)   Appointment; Term: There is hereby created the office of village
collector, an executive office of the village, which village collector shall be
appointed for a tenure of one year or for such other period as the board of
trustees of the village may determine.
   (B)   Clerk As Village Collector: The board of trustees may designate and
appoint the village clerk as the village collector as allowed by statute, or
the board may appoint any other eligible and qualified person deemed
appropriate as the village collector.
   (C)   Duties:
      1.   The village collector shall collect and receive all money due to the
village that is not by law paid directly to the village treasurer, including
the collection of special assessments and special taxes, and to keep such
records pertaining to the collection and receipt of these funds, providing
copies of such records to the village treasurer as may be required by statute
or village ordinance. Further, the village collector shall prepare and send
bills to all persons indebted to the village for water and sewer services and
any other service or debts due to the village.
      2.   The village collector shall disburse monies and funds on behalf of
the village only upon warrant of the village president, countersigned by the
village clerk, and such warrant shall state the fund or appropriation to which
the warrant is chargeable and to whom payable.
      3.   The village collector shall preserve all warrants returned to the
collector.
      4.   The village collector shall record upon a register an entry of all
warrants and vouchers paid or received on behalf of the village, describing
them and showing date, amount, number, the fund from which paid, to whom and
when paid. A copy of such register shall be provided to the village treasurer
on a monthly basis, or more often if required by the board of trustees.
      5.   The village collector shall supervise and be responsible for the
performance of the duties of his office delegated or handled by other personnel
that may be authorized by the board of trustees.
      6.   The village collector shall deliver all monies and funds collected
or received on behalf of the village to the village treasurer at least once
each week, or more often if required by the board of trustees, and receive a
receipt therefor, and will make a monthly report to the board showing what
money has been received and the source thereof. The village collector may
deposit said monies and funds collected or received on behalf of the village
into designated depositories, providing receipt of such action to the village
treasurer, as a means to fulfill this obligation to the village treasurer.
      7.   The village collector shall also make an annual report during the
last month of the fiscal year showing all the activities of the office.
      8.   The village collector shall keep all warrants, books, vouchers, and
papers pertaining to the office of collector open for the inspection by the
village president, village trustees, the village clerk, or any committee of the
village board.
   (D)   Salary: The salary or remuneration paid to the village collector for
the performance of duties required by that office shall be set and established
by the village board by means of a resolution or motion without the necessity
of an amending ordinance, but such motion or resolution shall require the same
number of votes for its adoption or passage as an ordinance would require. Such
salary or remuneration may be changed or adjusted from time to time in the same
manner. (Ord. 2002-16, 10-7-2002)
1-6-18: REPORTS:
Every officer of the village, except trustees, shall make and return to the
president of the board of trustees a semiannual statement, verified by
affidavit, of all fees and emoluments received by him during the preceding six
(6) months, which report shall be read to the board of trustees and filed by
the clerk. (R.O. 1908, Ord. 19)
1-6-19: ACCOUNTS AGAINST VILLAGE:
No account or claim against the village, excepting for the salary of village
officers, or for the payment of a special contract made by the board of
trustees, or by some officer of the village duly authorized to make the same,
or for the payment of any judgment against the village, or for the fee bills of
officers of court, shall be paid unless the person presenting the same or some
creditable person for him, shall make oath in writing, attached thereto that
the same is correct, due and unpaid.
No claim or account against the village upon any account made or indebtedness
incurred by any such officer shall be paid unless accompanied by a certificate
of such officer stating that he has examined such account or claim and believes
that it is correct, reasonable and in accordance with the contract. (R.O. 1908,
Ord. 23)
1-6-20: REMOVAL OF APPOINTED OFFICERS:
Any officer appointed under any of the provisions of this code may, by a
majority vote of the board of trustees, be removed at any time for
incompetency, neglect or violation of duty; provided that, no officer shall be
removed without due notice and opportunity to justify. (R.O. 1908, Ord. 19)
1-6-21: DELIVER BOOKS TO SUCCESSORS:
Every officer of the village shall, upon his resignation, removal or the
expiration of his term of office, deliver to his successor, within five (5)
days after demand, all papers, books, documents or other property belonging to
the village and pertaining to his office. (R.O. 1908, Ord. 19)
1-6-22: SUSPENSION OF OFFICERS:
(Rep. by Ord. 79-3, 5-7-1979, eff. 5-8-1979)
1-6-23: VIOLATION:
Any officer of the village who shall violate any of the provisions of this
chapter, or who shall wilfully refuse to perform any of the duties of his
office, or who shall be guilty of misfeasance or malfeasance in office shall be
deemed guilty of a misdemeanor. (R.O. 1908, Ord. 19)
1-6-24: SIGNING OF CHECKS, AUTHORIZATION:
   (A)   Grant Monies:
      1.   In any situation involving the disposition of grant monies, that is
grant monies coming from any source, be it federal, state or any other agency,
the check from the village disposing of those monies must be signed by two (2)
individuals duly authorized by the board of trustees of the village pursuant to
this section.
      2.   Those individuals authorized to sign on behalf of the village in
matters disposing of grant monies, are:
         (a)   The village clerk.
         (b)   The president of the board of trustees.
         (c)   In those situations where either the president of the board of
trustees or the village clerk is not available, then the chairman of the
village finance committee is authorized to sign as the second signatory. (Ord.
1986-7, 11-17-1986; amd. Ord. 1997-08, 9-2-1997)
   (B)   General Check Authorization:
      1.   All checks of the village will be signed by two (2) parties, those
two (2) parties being the duly appointed village clerk and the president of the
board of trustees of the village.
      2.   No check purportedly issued by the village will be valid unless it
is signed by the village clerk, or an acting village clerk so appointed by the
president and board of trustees, and the president of the board of trustees, or
an individual opting on behalf of the president of the board of trustees duly
appointed by the board of trustees. (Ord. 1997-08, 9-2-1997)
